masters.name: Marcus Aurelius
key_principles: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself.
The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive.
daily_practices: Morning reflection on what's in your control
Evening review of your actions and thoughts
Practice accepting what you cannot change

masters.name: David Goggins
masters.expertise: Mental toughness, extreme accountability, embracing suffering
key_principles: You are in danger of living a life so comfortable and soft that you will die without ever realizing your potential.
The only way to grow is to go to that dark place and get after it.
Most people stop at 40% of their capacity. The brain lies to protect you.
Suffering is a test. How you handle it determines who you become.
Nobody cares what you did yesterday. What are you doing today?
Callus your mind. Embrace the suck.
daily_practices: Do something that sucks every single day
When your mind says stop, do 10 more
Hold yourself accountable with radical honesty

masters.name: Jocko Willink
key_principles: Discipline equals freedom.
Extreme ownership: There are no bad teams, only bad leaders.
Don't let your ego get in the way of learning.
Prioritize and execute. Focus on the biggest problem first.
Default aggressive. When in doubt, take action.
Check the ego. The moment you think you know everything, you know nothing.
daily_practices: Wake up early. Win the first battle.
Take ownership of every problem in your life
Make discipline your identity, not a chore

masters.name: Carol Dweck
key_principles: In a growth mindset, challenges are exciting rather than threatening.
Becoming is better than being.
The passion for stretching yourself and sticking to it, even when it's not going well, is the hallmark of the growth mindset.
No matter what your ability is, effort is what ignites that ability and turns it into accomplishment.
Just because some people can do something with little or no training doesn't mean others can't do it with training.
Effort is one of those things that gives meaning to life.

masters.name: Ryan Holiday
masters.expertise: Stoicism, obstacle as the way, ego management
key_principles: The obstacle is the way. What stands in the way becomes the way.
Ego is the enemy. It's the voice that tells you you're special, you're better.
Stillness is the key. In stillness, we find clarity.
You don't control events, but you control how you respond.
Perception, action, will. That's the stoic formula.
Alive time or dead time. You choose.
daily_practices: Reframe every obstacle as an opportunity
Journal about your perceptions and responses

masters.name: Nassim Taleb
masters.expertise: Antifragility, uncertainty, skin in the game
key_principles: Antifragile: Some things benefit from shocks; they thrive and grow when exposed to volatility.
Wind extinguishes a candle and energizes fire. Be the fire.
The best way to verify that you are alive is by checking if you like variations.
If you want to accelerate someone's death, give them a personal doctor.
Never trust anyone who doesn't have skin in the game.
The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and a monthly salary.
daily_practices: Expose yourself to small stressors daily
Build redundancy and options in your life

daily_insights: Your thoughts create your reality. Guard them like a fortress.
Comfort is the enemy of progress. Seek discomfort daily.
You're not your emotions. You're the observer of your emotions.
Every setback is a setup for a comeback. Reframe everything.
The quality of your questions determines the quality of your life.
Discipline is choosing what you want most over what you want now.
Your identity drives your behavior. Change who you are, change what you do.
Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional. It's how you interpret the pain.
Confidence comes from kept promises to yourself. Keep small promises daily.
The obstacle is not in your way. It is the way.
skill_challenges: Do one thing today that scares you.
Take a cold shower. Embrace the discomfort.
Journal for 10 minutes: What am I avoiding and why?
Identify one limiting belief. Write down evidence against it.
Go 24 hours without complaining. Notice how often you want to.
Do something uncomfortable for someone else today.
Meditate for 10 minutes. Just observe your thoughts.
Write down 3 things you're grateful for. Be specific.
Identify one way you made an excuse today. Take ownership instead.
Say no to one thing you'd normally say yes to. Protect your priorities.
